718960f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - Murray Street
718960f-a.text:
City Hall Park: A view of the Subway construction in the western side
of the Park. The view is northward and shows buildings lining the
west side of Broadway, north from Murray to Chambers Street.
April 19, 1991.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
iam B. Parsons Collection.

717190f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - Murray Street
717190f-a.text:
(1)
253-257 Broadway, at and adjoining the N.W. corner of Murray Street.
The 12-story corner structure Nos. 253-255, is the Postal Telegraph, Cable
Building; the adjoining one, Nos. 256-257, being the Home Life Insurance
Building. Also shown is a view westward on the north side of Murray,.to
Church Streets, with the 12-story Franklin Building iNos. 9-15hadjoining the
August 15, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
A similar view, slightly more inclusive and showing a portion of the
Rogers, Peet and Co. Building, No. 258-259 Broadway, an 8-story structure
at the S.W. corner of Warren Street. The photographers vantage point is
in City Hall Park; the western edge of which is Broadway.

717195f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - Murray Street
717195f-a.text:
243-247 Broadway, south of, adjoining, and at the S.W. corner
of Murray Street.
About 1925.
Louis H. Dreyer.

718957f-b.title: Manhattan: Broadway - Murray Street
718957f-b.text:
City Hall Park: A group of citizens being addressed through an
amplifier svstem in front of the City Hall. Buildings in the backgruund
form the west side of Broaday, between Murray Street (right) and Park
Place (left). This is a set of 2 views.
About 19341
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

717191f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - Murray Street
717191f-a.text:
Broadway, West side, north from and including Murray to Chambers
Streets, showing the structures that faced City Hall Park. Shown on the
left, at the S.W. corner of Murray Street is the Importers and Traders
Bank. Upon the block front north of same stands the Postal Telegraph
Cable, the Home Life Insurance Co. and the Rogers, Peet and Co. Buildings.
Note the cobblestones and horse drawn street cars.
1888.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

717197f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - Murray Street
717197f-a.text:
Broadway, north from Murray (extreme left) and Mail (right foreground) St's.
showing on the east side of Broadway, the western edge of City Hall Park.
about 1931
Ewing Galloway
NO RERR ODUCTIONS

718954f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - Murray Street
718954f-a.text:
Citr Hall Jark: Several men and a team of horses clearing the
walks in the Park. The vie is southwestward and mainly the row of
on the west side of Broadway, south from Murray Street (exhreme right)
to Park Place. At the latter is shown the lower stories of the Woolworth
Building. On the extreme left appears the U.S. Post Office.
About 1928.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

717194f-c.title: Manhattan: Broadway - Murray Street
717194f-c.text:
(1)
247 to 243 Broadway, at, adjoining and south of the S.W. corner of
Murray Street, showing, under demolition, the Importers' and Traders' Office
of The Eouitable Crust Co. of New York (No. 247). Also seen is Murray Street
(right), south side, west from and including Broadway.
March 22, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The sage. Prominently shown is the Park-Murray Building.
April 18, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(3)
An earlier view of the complete block (Nos. 239 to 247) between Park
Place and Murray Street, showing the Cook (Tourist) Building, No. 245, under
improvement. On the left is the Woolworth Building.
January 20, 1925.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

717196f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - Murray Street
717196f-a.text:
Broadway, west side, south from Murray Street, showing W.P.A.
employees engaged in removing surface car tracks.
September 14, 1936.
W.P.A. Photo.
Federal Art Project.
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE ON ALL REPRODUCTIONS.
